attributes.comment:
Please DO NOT increase the fees in question. It is a deterrent to people who are
trying to adopt internationally but don't have the *substantial* money required,
one of the largest fees of which is the U.S. government's I-600A plus
fingerprinting fees.

The children being adopted are likely to be major contributors to our society
because they will have parents who are exceptionally devoted to their care.
Therefore, the increased fees will serve as a deterrent to adding such
contributors to our society. USCIS provides fee exemption to people who are
claiming asylum or are victims of sex trafficking, etc., but USCIS refuses to
admit people who will become a public burden (i.e. dependent on public
programs), unless they are otherwise victims. Internationally adopted children
are likely to grow up and add value to society instead of draining resources.

Please do not put additional roadblocks up to prevent us from being able to adopt.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jennifer J Jacobs
